publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7980 Stewart Maxwell: Neighbours Who Disappeared Exhibition, Paisley—That the Parliament welcomes the Neighbours Who Disappeared Holocaust exhibition, which is on display at Paisley Museum until 27 March 2011; congratulates Castlehead High School in Paisley for organising the arrival of this exhibition from the Education and Cultural Centre of the Jewish Museum in Prague, and encourages as many people as possible to visit what it considers this fascinating and moving account of Jewish families who disappeared from Czech villages during World War II. Supported by: Bill Kidd*, Stuart McMillan*, Alasdair Allan*, Jackson Carlaw*, Christina McKelvie*, Stewart Stevenson*, Patricia Ferguson*

S3M-7980 Neighbours Who Disappeared Exhibition, Paisley (lodged on 22 February 2011) Jamie Hepburn*, Rob Gibson*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Bob Doris*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Brian Adam*, Kenneth Gibson*, Robin Harper*, Hugh Henry*

S3M-7980 Stewart Maxwell: Neighbours Who Disappeared Exhibition, Paisley—That the Parliament welcomes the Neighbours Who Disappeared Holocaust exhibition, which is on display at Paisley Museum until 27 March 2011; congratulates Castlehead High School in Paisley for organising the arrival of this exhibition from the Education and Cultural Centre of the Jewish Museum in Prague, and encourages as many people as possible to visit what it considers this fascinating and moving account of Jewish families who disappeared from Czech villages during World War II. Supported by: Bill Kidd, Stuart McMillan, Alasdair Allan, Jackson Carlaw, Christina McKelvie, Stewart Stevenson, Patricia Ferguson, Jamie Hepburn, Rob Gibson, Ms Wendy Alexander, Bob Doris, Joe FitzPatrick, Brian Adam, Kenneth Gibson, Robin Harper, Hugh Henry, Gil Paterson*
S3M-7980 Neighbours Who Disappeared Exhibition, Paisley (lodged on 22 February 2011) Trish Godman*
